2019-12-01T15:14:49Z: Here's the report - and that's it for the season! Thanks for joining us, and we'll see you next year! Hamilton dominates F1 Abu Dhabi GP, Verstappen beats Leclerc to P2Lewis Hamilton ended his title-winning 2019 Formula 1 season by dominating the Abu Dhabi Grand Prix, as Max Verstappen overcame a power problem to pass Charles Leclerc and finish second
2019-12-01T15:03:43Z: The drivers take to the podium for the final time this season - Hamilton flanked by Verstappen and Leclerc.
2019-12-01T14:52:32Z: Hamilton pulls a few doughnuts on the start-finish line, before assuming his position behind the #1 board.
2019-12-01T14:48:44Z: Verstappen takes second, and Leclerc just about hangs on to third - with Bottas just within a second.
2019-12-01T14:48:13Z: Sainz and Ricciardo have demoted Hulkenberg from 10th to 12th.
2019-12-01T14:47:56Z: And 2019 is over, with Lewis Hamilton taking victory at Abu Dhabi!
2019-12-01T14:47:53Z: Perez has passed Norris for seventh.
2019-12-01T14:46:16Z: Perez is still harassing Norris, but the McLaren driver it firmly hanging on so far.
2019-12-01T14:44:53Z: Vettel tries to steam past Albon with DRS - he can't do it into turn 8, but it's significantly easier into the next set of corners.
2019-12-01T14:43:55Z: Bottas is now just 3s behind Leclerc. It'll be tight, as Leclerc lost 0.8s on that lap.
2019-12-01T14:41:02Z: Despite having the DRS available, Perez is unable to find a way past Norris just yet.
2019-12-01T14:40:52Z: The TV graphics show that a predicted final lap battle over third will ensue between Bottas and Leclerc. Leclerc's only option for the late stop was softs, having no other fresh compounds available.
2019-12-01T14:39:47Z: Perez is within a second of Norris's seventh place.
2019-12-01T14:37:55Z: Leclerc's presumed Plan C isn't entirely working as his pace is slower than Verstappen and Bottas's. The latter is still in with a shout of a podium here.
2019-12-01T14:35:45Z: With seven laps to go, Stroll becomes the first driver to retire from this event.
2019-12-01T14:35:01Z: Stroll is being wheeled into the garage to retire.
2019-12-01T14:34:20Z: Now Kvyat is chasing Hulkenberg - and he demotes the Renault with a bold move into Turn 11 at the end of the second straight.
2019-12-01T14:33:06Z: Leclerc is 22.5s behind Verstappen, with Bottas a further 8.8s back.
2019-12-01T14:32:37Z: Hamilton was almost 2s quicker than Verstappen on the previous lap, but the difference between the two has stagnated on this tour.
2019-12-01T14:32:08Z: Perez is all over Hulkenberg - and he dives by at Turn 8 to take eighth.
2019-12-01T14:30:47Z: There's 10 laps to go, and Hamilton has a 17s lead over Verstappen. It's hard to see this going any other way at this stage.
2019-12-01T14:29:40Z: Sainz just rocketed past Magnussen on the main straight using his fresh tyres and DRS - he's up to P12 already.
2019-12-01T14:28:02Z: Ricciardo pits to take the softs - he'll be covering Sainz.
2019-12-01T14:26:08Z: Sainz pits from ninth - he'll be trying to go on the attack in the closing stages.
2019-12-01T14:24:57Z: Hamilton has lots of traffic ahead, with Perez and Sainz expecting to see blue flags pretty sharpish.
2019-12-01T14:24:09Z: Kvyat pits from seventh - he's the last driver to stop.
2019-12-01T14:23:50Z: Perez uses his fresh hards to pass Ricciardo for P11 - he's homing in on Sainz, Hulkenberg and Norris, too.
2019-12-01T14:23:02Z: After those stops, the top three remain in place - and Bottas, Albon and Vettel form the remainder of the top six.
2019-12-01T14:21:05Z: Bottas dispatches Albon into turn 8, taking fourth place. Albon doesn't have the straightline speed to come back at him into T11.
2019-12-01T14:20:08Z: Leclerc comes in to pit for softs, and in the process means we called what Plan C was. Ferrari double-stacks again, with no problems for Vettel this time.
2019-12-01T14:19:36Z: Perez has finally pitted - he's come back out in P12.
2019-12-01T14:17:24Z: There's a battle a-brewing for fourth - Albon is 1.6s behind Vettel, and Bottas is closing in on them.
2019-12-01T14:16:43Z: Russell has slipped by Kubica to take P18 from his Williams team-mate - they're still ahead of Gasly after his lengthy stop at the beginning of the race.
2019-12-01T14:15:32Z: There's a replay of a piece of debris being kicked up by Vettel, which is kicked into touch by Albon.
2019-12-01T14:13:24Z: Perez has now done 35 laps on the medium tyres, which is pretty good going. He remains seventh.
2019-12-01T14:12:35Z: In among the radio chatter and overtaking moves, Bottas did a 1m39.715s to set a new track record.
2019-12-01T14:11:07Z: Leclerc, meanwhile, proffers the idea of Plan C. Is that a switch to softs?
2019-12-01T14:10:40Z: After a bit more radio traffic, Verstappen is told he's going to have to live with whatever ails him.
2019-12-01T14:09:08Z: Leclerc comes back at him on the next straight! The Ferrari driver is less successful - and Verstappen cements P2.
2019-12-01T14:09:03Z: Verstappen puts a fantastic move on Leclerc, diving down the inside of turn 8 as Leclerc also puts a lap on Russell! Incredible.
2019-12-01T14:05:50Z: Verstappen is now closing in on Leclerc at a vast rate of knots. He's having a moan about his at the same time, proving to be an excellent multi-tasker.
2019-12-01T14:02:46Z: Hamilton pumps in a 1m41.070s lap, so he's evidently going for a Grand Slam...
2019-12-01T14:00:49Z: Kubica and Giovinazzi will have no further action taken against them for their clash.
2019-12-01T13:58:26Z: The Kubica/Giovinazzi clash is being formally investigated by the stewards.
2019-12-01T13:57:25Z: Verstappen pits as we say that, taking hard tyres. Leclerc gets past, as Verstappen rejoins in third.
2019-12-01T13:56:32Z: Giovinazzi manages to pass Kubica without hitting him - the Alfa driver is up to P15.
2019-12-01T13:56:31Z: Hamilton and Verstappen are going quite deep into the race on mediums - they're about to complete their 25th laps on those tyres.
2019-12-01T13:54:55Z: The stewards have noted the clash between Kubica and Giovinazzi.
2019-12-01T13:53:43Z: Replays reveal Giovinazzi and Kubica bashed into each other at Turn 12, which caused a fair few bits to come off the Williams.
2019-12-01T13:52:46Z: The Norris-Hulkenberg-Sainz-Ricciardo train is homing in on Raikkonen and Kvyat at the end of the top 10.
2019-12-01T13:51:28Z: Some gaps: Hamilton is 13s clear of Verstappen, and Leclerc is a further 16s behind. It's all very close, as you can see...
2019-12-01T13:50:46Z: Kvyat and Raikkonen are dicing over P8 - and the Toro Rosso driver takes the position into Turn 11.
2019-12-01T13:49:19Z: Magnussen pits from eighth for Haas.
2019-12-01T13:47:13Z: Hulkenberg has used his fresh mediums to immediately pass Sainz for P12.
2019-12-01T13:46:44Z: Vettel hasn't been able to go with Bottas, and is within DRS range of Albon behind him.
2019-12-01T13:46:27Z: Hulkenberg rejoins in P13 - behind the two McLarens.
2019-12-01T13:45:42Z: Hulkenberg pits, letting Vettel and Albon trickle through into fifth and sixth.
2019-12-01T13:45:32Z: Norris and Sainz have used the return of DRS to pass Grosjean and demote him to P14.
2019-12-01T13:44:38Z: Hulkenberg is a sitting duck now, and Bottas clears the German driver with consummate ease into turn 8.
2019-12-01T13:44:01Z: DRS has been enabled - to be honest, it's almost been better without it.
2019-12-01T13:43:26Z: Vettel has a go at Bottas into turn 8, but is somewhat circumspect - he tries again after the next straight, but he just can't do the deed. Bottas remains P4.
2019-12-01T13:41:56Z: Hamilton tells his engineers that his rears are heating up, but he seems fine for the time being. The gap to  Verstappen is at 11s, and crucially he's kept the gap to Leclerc pretty static.
2019-12-01T13:41:06Z: Without DRS, Bottas isn't making the progress he'd hoped for, and Hulkenberg is holding onto fourth as Vettel and Albon join the battle.
2019-12-01T13:40:31Z: Sainz has now got back ahead of Ricciardo.
2019-12-01T13:40:19Z: Sainz and Ricciardo have escaped an investigation into Sainz cutting the first chicane as they battled a few laps ago - because the McLaren driver gave P14 back to Ricciardo.
2019-12-01T13:39:34Z: Vettel is looking to find a way past Bottas and Hulkenberg, and needs to clear them quickly as Albon's closing in on him.
2019-12-01T13:37:59Z: All the stops have helped Bottas rise to fifth behind Hulkenberg - but they're yet to stop.
2019-12-01T13:37:00Z: Albon's in and out, taking fresh hard tyres. He'll go to the end on those.
2019-12-01T13:36:06Z: Vettel immediately locks said left-front up into turn 8, but passes Perez anyway.
2019-12-01T13:35:29Z: Ferrari decide to double-stack cars, bringing in Leclerc first...but Vettel's stop is painfully slow as his left-front goes on glacially!
2019-12-01T13:34:22Z: Bottas passes Perez into Turn 8 at the end of the main straight to move up to eighth.
2019-12-01T13:33:58Z: Ricciardo pits from seventh to take the hard tyres - he rejoins in 15th, just behind Norris.
2019-12-01T13:33:14Z: Vettel stays out for another lap, leaving the Ferrari mechanic spotted holding a tyre to take a breather for at least a couple more minutes.
2019-12-01T13:31:19Z: Sainz is now sixth after Norris's stop, and is being hunted down by the two Renaults. They need to scarper, because Bottas is not too far away and closing in on ninth-placed Perez.
2019-12-01T13:29:25Z: Perez is dragging Bottas towards the Renaults, which are running seventh and eighth.
2019-12-01T13:29:13Z: Leclerc is going faster on this lap, but reports wheel vibrations and asks the team to check the tyres.
2019-12-01T13:28:31Z: Giovinazzi has also come in to be serviced by Alfa.
2019-12-01T13:28:05Z: Norris pits from sixth - he goes onto the hard tyres.
2019-12-01T13:27:16Z: The gap between Hamilton and Leclerc is now at 4.3s - and the world champion was a good half-second quicker than the Monegasque on the previous lap.
2019-12-01T13:25:57Z: Bottas takes P11 from Magnussen at the end of the second straight - the Haas driver sensibly didn't fight that one.
2019-12-01T13:25:01Z: Bottas is already under 0.5s behind Magnussen in P11-P12.
2019-12-01T13:24:37Z: Albon has dropped away from Vettel, falling 3.1s behind the Ferrari. Vettel's failure to pass Verstappen earlier has meant he's slipped back somewhat too.
2019-12-01T13:24:13Z: Perez has passed Magnussen - he's now running in 10th.
2019-12-01T13:23:58Z: Bottas immediately catches up to Giovinazzi and passes the Alfa into Turn 8 at the end of the main straight,
2019-12-01T13:23:15Z: Stroll has pitted and drops to P19.
2019-12-01T13:22:20Z: Leclerc is now starting to lose ground to Hamilton in sector two as well, but the Ferrari still has the first part of the course locked out.
2019-12-01T13:22:06Z: Next up for Bottas is Giovinazzi in P12.
2019-12-01T13:21:45Z: Bottas nips by Stroll into the first chicane - lacking DRS not a factor there.
2019-12-01T13:20:37Z: The lack of DRS is helping Stroll keep Bottas behind.
2019-12-01T13:20:25Z: Hamilton has opened the gap to Leclerc more - he's done a 1m42.503s on that last lap to become the fastest man on track.
2019-12-01T13:19:15Z: A technical issue has disabled the use of DRS for the time being.
2019-12-01T13:18:23Z: The stewards have declared that there is no investigation necessary for the Stroll/Gasly/Perez clash.
2019-12-01T13:17:45Z: Bottas is up to 14th at the start of lap three.
2019-12-01T13:17:26Z: Gasly is only just leaving the pits - it took an age to get the old nose off.
2019-12-01T13:17:24Z: Leclerc now has the problem of trying to get near Hamilton - he takes 0.5s out in the first couple of sectors, but loses 0.8s in the final part of the lap.
2019-12-01T13:17:00Z: Replays reveal that is was contact from Stroll that twisted Gasly into Perez as he ran on the outside of Turn 1, with Gasly losing his front wing against the rear of Perez's car.
2019-12-01T13:16:00Z: Gasly pits - he's missing his front wing.
2019-12-01T13:15:55Z: Hamilton ends the first lap with 1.6s in hand over Leclerc.
2019-12-01T13:15:49Z: Gasly runs last - looks like he was the car going off at Turn 1 after contact with the Racing Points.
2019-12-01T13:15:05Z: Leclerc gets Verstappen into turn 8, teeing up a nice move in the slipstream and getting by. Vettel tries the same into turn 11, but can't make it past.
2019-12-01T13:15:02Z: Bottas is already slicing his way up from the back of the grid - he's into 16th already.
2019-12-01T13:14:22Z: There's contact in the pack at Turn 1 - looks like the Racing Points and Toro Rosso got together and went wide.
2019-12-01T13:14:15Z: The frontrunners are all away cleanly, but there's a yellow flag in sector one...
2019-12-01T13:13:36Z: And the final race of the season begins!
2019-12-01T13:12:36Z: The cars make their way to their grid spots for the final time in 2019...
2019-12-01T13:12:17Z: Hamilton, Verstappen, Leclerc, Albon, Perez, Gasly, Stroll, Magnussen, Grosjean, Raikkonen and Bottas are on mediums. Vettel, Norris, Ricciardo, Sainz, Hulkenbeg and Giovinazzi start on softs, and it's hards for Kvyat and the Williamses.
2019-12-01T13:10:22Z: The final formation lap of the year begins.
2019-12-01T13:09:33Z: Notes from qualifying - Norris shades the McLaren intra-team battle, being Sainz in qualifying 11-10. It's a cricket score at Williams, as Russell heads Kubica 21-0.
2019-12-01T13:04:32Z: Hamilton begins this one from pole, starting on the front row with Verstappen as Bottas was sent to the back of the grid for taking two new engines this weekend. Ferrari has the second row to itself.
2019-12-01T13:03:26Z: Everyone's gearing up for the start. It's been a rather warm day, although it's cooling down as the sun begins to drop.
2019-12-01T12:52:39Z: Hello and welcome to the final race of the 2019 season! In just under 20 minutes, the race will be underway...so make yourself a cuppa, sit down and watch the action unfold for the last time this year
